H0.text: Solute is what the student makes by dissolving a spoonful of sugar in a glass of water.

H1.text: A solvent is what a student makes when dissolving a spoonful of sugar in a glass of water.

H2.text: Solution is made when a student dissolves a spoonful of sugar in a glass of water.

H3.text: Suspension is what the student makes when dissolving a spoonful of sugar in a glass of water.

A4.text: sugar water, which contains dissolved sucrose

A5.text: sugar water is a solution of sucrose in water
